conclusion: Understand the given circuit and parameters to focus on the transformer's turns ratio.
The image depicts an ideal transformer connected to an AC power source with an ammeter showing 1.4 A and three equal resistances (50 Ω each) on the secondary side with a voltmeter showing 10 V.
Identify the components: primary side has an ammeter reading 1.4 A; secondary side contains three equal resistances (50 Ω each) and a voltmeter reading 10 V.
Calculate the equivalent resistance on the secondary side: R_eq = R1 + R2 + R3 = 150 Ω.
Use Ohm's law to find the current on the secondary side: I_eq = V / R_eq = 0.0667 A.
Determine the turns ratio: n = I1 / I_eq = 21.
The turns ratio of the primary and secondary coils of the transformer is 21.
